content.rendered:
2 July 2015 – Offshore marine and engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar is to open an office in Busan, South Korea, following increased demand for the company’s services.

“Over the past few months we have received an increasing number of work requests from oil services companies, rig operators and the numerous offshore construction yards in South Korea.  It is therefore a logical expansion of our network to set up an office here now, so that we are able to provide the best possible local support to our clients,” says Phil Lenox, Director – Asia Pacific, AqualisBraemar.

The Busan office will offer AqualisBraemar’s full range of services with support from other group offices.  However, its initial focus will be on dynamic positioning consultancy, transportation and installation, marine warranty and construction supervision. 

Mr Gang-Yeoung Jeong has been appointed as general manager of the company’s office in Busan.  South Korea is the 11th country AqualisBraemar enters after the company was established in 2013.

AqualisBraemar is a specialised marine and offshore engineering consultancy focusing on the shallow and deep-water segments of the offshore oil, gas and wind industries.

excerpt.rendered: 2 July 2015 – Offshore marine and engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar is to open an office in Busan, South Korea, following increased demand for the company’s services.

jetpack-related-posts.title: South Korea next for OWC
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC has decided to set up an office in South Korea in order to support the country’s ambitious offshore wind plans. Industry senior NJ Park has been appointed OWC’s country manager.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar appoints head of South East Asia
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar has appointed John Harris as its new regional managing director of the South East Asia region.

jetpack-related-posts.title: McDermott signs up AqualisBraemar
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar has entered into a master services agreement with McDermott Asia Pacific Sdn Bhd (McDermott) to provide engineering reviews and marine warranty services for the company’s offshore operations in the Asia Pacific region.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar opens office in Shanghai
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 2 May 2014 - Offshore marine and engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar continues its rapid global expansion plan and opens an office in Shanghai, China. Just twelve months after starting operations, AqualisBraemar has established 12 offices in nine countries worldwide. “China has a growing offshore oil and gas industry and a number…

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar to perform DP approvals for Daehan Shipyard
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar has been tasked by Daehan Shipbuilding Co. Ltd, a new leading shipyard for Aframax and Suezmax tankers, to undertake a DP and BLS system FMEA on a shuttle tanker being built by the South Korean shipyard for Greek tanker giant Tsakos Energy Navigation.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC strengthens Korean presence
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC has hired Assistant Project Manager Jin Sook Kim (known as Irene Kim) to strengthen its presence in the South Korean offshore wind market.
